tools.name: api-health
tools.description: Checks the health and availability of Veracode API endpoints

tools.name: dynamic-findings
tools.description: Get runtime vulnerabilities from platform-based DYNAMIC analysis scans (auth/session flaws, authorization bypasses, CSRF, clickjacking, etc.)

params.name: application_path
params.description: Absolute path to the application workspace

params.name: app_profile
params.description: Application name (auto-detected if not provided)

params.name: severity
params.description: Exact severity (0=Info, 1=VeryLow, 2=Low, 3=Med, 4=High, 5=VeryHigh)

params.name: severity_gte
params.description: Minimum severity (0-5)

params.name: cwe_ids
params.description: Filter by CWE IDs (e.g., [89, 79] for SQLi and XSS)

params.name: page_size
params.description: Findings per page (1-500, default 10)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number (0-based, default 0)

params.name: violates_policy
params.description: Filter by policy violation status. Default is true (policy violations only). Only set this parameter if the user explicitly asks to see all findings regardless of policy. Do not set it to false unless directly requested.

tools.name: finding-details
tools.description: Get detailed information about any flaw from platform scans (static/dynamic) or pipeline scans. Returns complete flaw details including data flow paths or request/response info for dynamic flaws. Use this to get more context on any specific flaw ID from scan results.

params.name: application_path
params.description: Absolute path to the application workspace

params.name: app_profile
params.description: Application name (auto-detected if not provided). Only used for platform scans.

params.name: flaw_id
params.description: Flaw ID to retrieve. Format: '1234' for platform scans, '1234-1' for pipeline scans with occurrence number.

tools.name: remediation-guidance
tools.description: Fix flaws, vulnerabilities, or security issues found in pipeline scan results. Provides language-specific remediation guidance, secure code examples, and step-by-step fix instructions for any pipeline scan finding. Use this when user wants to fix, remediate, or resolve a specific flaw ID or issue from pipeline results.

params.name: application_path
params.description: Absolute path to the application workspace

params.name: flaw_id
params.description: Pipeline scan flaw ID (string format with occurrence, e.g., "1026-1", "1026-2", "999-1"). Copy the exact flaw ID from pipeline-findings output.
